# OpenAI?s new image model has arrived? and it seems like the fastest, smartest image generator yet? 

View image: (https://media.beehiiv.com/cdn-cgi/image/fit=scale-down,format=auto,onerror=redirect,quality=80/uploads/asset/file/18a406e6-78f3-4e3c-b520-19c8d40f7be5/Screenshot_2025-12-16_at_12.14.27_PM.png?t=1765916750)
Caption: If you don?t know what this image is referencing, [watch this](https://x.com/mrexits/status/1951509582825791864)

**News brief: **[OpenAI?s new image model, explained](https://www.theneuron.ai/explainer-articles/openais-new-image-model-has-arrived-and-it-seems-like-the-fastest-smartest-image-generator-yet)

Y?know how when you ask ChatGPT to generate or edit a single image, it takes at least 30 seconds to wait for it, only to find the text was misspelled or your edits changed everything except what you actually wanted?

Well, [OpenAI just released GPT Image 1.5](https://openai.com/index/new-chatgpt-images-is-here/), and it's 4x faster while being significantly better at actually following your instructions. The model is rolling out now to all ChatGPT users and is [available in the API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/images) as GPT-Image-1.5 ([docs](https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/image-generation)). 

**Here's what makes it different: **The new model preserves what matters. When you ask for edits, it changes only what you specify while keeping lighting, composition, and people's appearance consistent across multiple edits. 

Translation: _no more accidentally transforming your subject's entire face into a hideous Renaissance painting alternate universe version of itself when you just wanted to change the background. _

**Where GPT Image 1.5 excels:**

* **Precise editing**: Add, subtract, combine, blend, or transpose elements without losing the image's essence.

* **Text rendering**: Finally handles dense, small text accurately (think readable newspaper layouts, not jumbled letters).

* **Instruction following**: Creates intricate compositions with proper relationships between elements?like an actual 6x6 grid with 36 different objects, each in the right spot.

* **Creative transformations**: Apply preset styles instantly; turn photos into movie posters, 80s fitness ads, or fashion campaigns while preserving key details.

* **Speed**: Up to 4x faster than the previous version, so you can iterate without the wait.

OpenAI also launched a [dedicated Images interface](https://chatgpt.com/images/) in the ChatGPT sidebar with preset filters, trending prompts, and one-time likeness uploads (kinda like [Sora Cameos](https://help.openai.com/en/articles/12435986-generating-content-with-characters)) for easier creation.

**How does it stack up against the competition? **According to[ independent benchmarks](https://x.com/ArtificialAnlys/status/2001016199094948185), OpenAI dominates:

* **Text-to-image:** GPT Image 1.5 leads with 1264 points on the[ Artificial Analysis leaderboard](https://artificialanalysis.ai/image/leaderboard/text-to-image)?a 29-point lead over second place.

* **Image editing:** ChatGPT's image model tops[ LM Arena](https://lmarena.ai/leaderboard/image-edit) at 1409 points, narrowly beating Google's Nano Banana Pro (2K) by 3 points, and has a 6 point lead over Nano Banana Pro on Artificial Analysis? [image editing leaderboard](https://artificialanalysis.ai/image/leaderboard/editing). 

* **Improvements: **+147 points in [text-to-image](https://lmarena.ai/leaderboard/text-to-image) and +245 points in editing over GPT Image 1.0 on [LM Arena](https://lmarena.ai/leaderboard/image-edit).

**Think of it like this: **GPT Image 1.5 = speed and precision edits. Nano Banana Pro = production-grade assets with additional enterprise features.

**Why this matters**: AI image generation just crossed a critical threshold. For the first time, these tools can actually preserve what you care about while changing what you want? reliably. No more generating 50 versions hoping one works. 

If you create visual content for work, try the new ChatGPT Images interface to test it out or [test both models head-to-head in LM Arena](https://lmarena.ai/) or [AA Image Arena](https://artificialanalysis.ai/image/arena) to see which fits your workflow better.

**P.S: **We tested it on the same challenge we gave Nano Banana Pro in our [live-demo of GPT-5.2](https://www.youtube.com/live/5r3CiTJ3_z4?si=ZJ-p0x_RsBPYEZCC&t=6457) on Friday, and [this is what it created](https://chatgpt.com/share/6941da07-d8cc-8003-8723-aad812e4bbb8).

# Prompt Tip of the Day

Tired of juggling docs, Slack threads, and random context across 12 tools? Product manager Amir Klein shared a [3-step system](https://www.lennysnewsletter.com/p/how-to-build-your-pm-second-brain) with Lenny?s newsletter for building your ?second brain? using ChatGPT?s ?Projects? feature:

1. **Create its personality** using ChatGPT to write custom instructions for the exact thought partner you need.

2. **Feed it everything**: PRDs, decks, Excel sheets, Slack channels exported as PDFs _(everything is text!)._

3. **Let it cook** on sign-up forms, strategy docs, prototypes, roadmaps, whatever needs doing.

Klein's Project now holds _hundreds_ of files and handles tasks that used to drain his mental energy.

**TL;DR:** This isn't about outsourcing judgment. It's about clearing mental overhead so you can focus on what actually matters: your reasoning, creativity, and decision-making.

Caption: 

Ever recorded a podcast with a barking dog in the background? Or filmed a street performance where traffic drowns out the music?

[Meta's SAM Audio](https://about.fb.com/news/2025/12/our-new-sam-audio-model-transforms-audio-editing/) lets you isolate specific sounds from complex audio mixtures using three intuitive prompts:

* **Text**: Type "dog barking" to extract that sound.

* **Visual**: Click objects in video to isolate their audio.

* **Time span**: Mark exact segments where target audio occurs.

**Use cases**: Remove background noise from recordings, isolate instruments from live bands, strip mouth noises from podcasts, separate dialogue from background sounds in video calls, or clean up audience noise from performances.

One Reddit user noted the model can even identify when a commentator accidentally taps their microphone?just prompt "tap on the microphone" and it finds the moment.

**Try it**: Available on [GitHub](https://github.com/facebookresearch/sam-audio), [Hugging Face](https://huggingface.co/collections/facebook/sam-audio), or test in [Meta's Segment Anything Playground here](https://aidemos.meta.com/segment-anything/).
